member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Context.Identity
member.summary:
Identity is a mapping of repository names onto sets of user credentials used in service authentication.
A service context is expected to contain only one identity per repository name. Identities will be set in a service context using one of two concrete subclasses: BasicIdentity and RepositoryIdentity.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Context.ServiceContext
member.summary:
ServiceContext contains mainly operation specific properties and is for optimization purpose.
ServiceContext can be passed over the wire containing only single token. This is an appropriate optimization in applications where multiple services will be created sharing the same ServiceContext, and the ServiceContext is of significant size. If the ServiceContext is small and profiles are largely contained within the OperationOptions argument, then registration of the service context will not result in a significant optimization.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Context.SsoIdentity
member.summary:
SsoIdentity extends the BasicIdentity parent class, and includes accessors for user name and password, but not for repository name.
This class can be used in cases where the service is known to access only a single repository, or in cases where the user credentials in all repositories are known to be identical. BasicIdentity can also be used to supply fallback credentials in the case where the user has differing credentials on some repositories, for which RepositoryIdentity instances will be set, and identical credentials on all other repositories.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.ContentProfile.PostTransferAction
member.summary:
Sets the command to handle the contents on client side after the transfer has been completed. It is used only for UCF transfer mode.
"dfs:view" runs the default viewer for each returned content
"dfs:edit" runs the default editor
"dfs:edit?app=notepad" runs the custom editor (notepad)
"dfs:edit?app=java-cp\"c:\\Program Files\\javacustomapp\\app.jar\"com.emc...ContentHandler" runs the custom content handler
OS equivalent is:
c:\> java -cp "c:\Program Files\javacustomapp\app.jar" com.emc...ContentHandler ContentsFileName

member.summary:
Specifies whether the assemblies should be copied with their assembly documents.
If true, then only the assembly parent will be copied.
If false, then all of the documents in the assembly will be copied and a new assembly structure will be created.

member.summary:
Specifies whether the relationships(containment or assembly) should be fixed.
If true, then the objects specified in the copy operation are copied but the relationships(containment or assembly) are not applied.
If false, then all relationships are resolved.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.CopyProfile.CopyChildrenAsReferences
member.summary:
Specifies whether the children in a virtual document are referenced when parent is copied or copy creates.
If false, Create new copies of referenced children when parent is copied.
If true, then reference existing children when parent is copied.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.DeleteProfile
member.summary:
DeleteProfile normally passed within OperationOptions, controls specific behaviors of the delete operation.
Has five internal properties:
IsDeepDeleteFolders - If true, deletes all folders under a folder specified in objectsToDelete. This setting does not specify whether non-folder objects that are linked into other folders are deleted from the repository. Default value is false.
IsDeepDeleteVdmInFolders - If true, for each folder specified in objectsToDelete, removes all virtual document children descended from virtual documents residing in the folder tree, even if the child objects of the virtual document reside in folders outside the folder tree descended from the specified folder. Default value is false.
VersionStrategy - DeleteVersionStrategy.SELECTED_VERSIONS delete only the specified version of the object. If CURRENT version only is deleted, the previous version becomes the CURRENT version. Default value is DeleteVersionStrategy#ALL_VERSIONS.
PopulateWithReferences - Specifies whether reference objects should be dereferenced during population i.e. when files/objects are added to the operation. True will indicate that the reference objects themselves will be added to the operation. False will indicate that reference objects will be dereferenced and the remote object will be added to the operation. The default is false.
deepDeleteChildrenInFolders -

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.DeleteProfile.IsDeleteVdm
member.summary: If true the delete operation will delete virtual document with all the children. If false (default) only the root of the virtual document will be deleted. This flag is processed only when the id of a virtual document root is passed to the operation. If to the operation is passed a folder id that contains a virtual document than all the children of the virtual document that are in the folder will be deleted. If isDeepDeleteVdmInFolders set to true than the children of the virtual document that resides under other folders will also be deleted.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.DeleteProfile.IsDeepDeleteVdmInFolders
member.summary: If true, for each folder specified in objectsToDelete, removes all virtual document children descended from virtual documents residing in the folder tree, even if the child objects of the virtual document reside in folders outside the folder tree descended from the specified folder.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.DeleteProfile.IsPopulateWithReferences
member.summary: Specifies whether reference objects should be dereferenced during population i.e. when files/objects are added to the operation. member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.PermissionProfile
member.summary:
The PermissionProfile class enables the client to set filters that control the contents of the Permission lists in DataObject instances returned by services.
By default, platform services return an empty Permission list: the client must explicitly request in a PermissionProfile that permissions be returned. The ContentProfile includes a single filter, PermissionTypeFilter, with a corresponding permissionType setting that is used or ignored depending on the PermissionTypeFilter value. The permissionType is specified with a Permission.PermissionType enum constant.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.PermissionProfile.IsUseCompoundPermissions
member.summary: This method controls dealing with compound permissions. For example, all basic permissions for Documentum are compound. If DELETE is specified, all other operations are automatically allowed. This is great from permission management but is less useful when evaluating what can be done with a given object. If IsUseCompoundPermissions is set to false (default), service is expected to return a separate instance of Permission for every applicable permission. If user is allowed to DELETE object, a list of all BASIC permissions will be returned: {BROWSE, READ, ..., DELETE}. If value is set to false, only DELETE permission entry will be returned.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.PropertyProfile
member.summary:
A PropertyProfile defines property filters that limit the properties returned with an object by a service.
This allows you to optimize the service by returning only those properties that your service consumer requires. PropertyProfile, like other profiles, normally is passed within OperationOptions. You specify how PropertyProfile filters returned properties by setting its FilterMode.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Profiles.RelationshipProfile
member.summary:
A RelationshipProfile is a client optimization mechanism that provides fine control over the size and complexity of DataObject instances returned by services.
By default, the object service get operation returns DataObject containing no Relationship instances. To alter this behavior, you must provide a RelationshipProfile that explicit sets the types of Relationship instances to return.

member.name: M:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Properties.ArrayProperty`1.AddDeletePropertySequence(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds to actions list a new ValueAction with ValueActionType.DELETE.
This method needs the index of the value in Object's property list. Each time a sequence is processed the Object's property list is reindexed.
For example. An object has a repeating string property "animals" = {lion, tiger, panther} we want on update to remove "lion" and "panther" values from the object. We should provide two delete sequences with indexes {0,1} First delete sequence will delete "lion" then the list is reindexed and we have a new list {tiger, panther} and the second delete sequence have to be with index 1.
member.param: index of the value in Object's property list.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Properties.ValueAction
member.summary:
ValueAction represents the intent of the user on the value on the provided index.
This class maps the index of the value in Object's property list with user's intent. Each time an action is processed the Object's property list is reindexed.
For example. An object has a repeating string property "animals" = {lion, tiger, panther} we want on update to remove "lion" and "panther" values from the object. We should provide two delete sequences with indexes {0,1} First delete sequence will delete "lion" then the list is reindexed and we have a new list {tiger, panther} and the second delete sequence have to be with index 1.

member.summary: Repository name this Scope applies to.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus
member.summary: RepositoryStatus enum specifies the detailedStatus of the .

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.TRUNCATED
member.summary: Indicates that the results have been truncated.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.INTERNAL_FAILURE
member.summary: Indicates that an internal error occurred, possibly due to an uncaught exception or an unavailable source.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.NOT_CONSTRAINED
member.summary: Indicates that the query was not sent to the source because the query properties are not supported by the source.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.UNREACHABLE
member.summary: Indicates that the query could not be processed because it failed too many times to connect to the source (network problem).

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.LOGIN_FAILED
member.summary: Indicates that the query could not be sent to the source because of an authentification failure (wrong password).

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.COULD_NOT_FETCH
member.summary: Indicates that the query could not be sent to the server because of an IO error.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.EXT_SOURCE_UNAVAILABLE
member.summary: Indicates that the connection with the external source was broken and the query could not complete properly.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.UNAVAILABLE
member.summary: Indicates that the source is not available. It may be temporary down or mispelled.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.QUERY_SCOPE_UNREACHABLE
member.summary: Indicates that at least one query scope is unreachable (either not found or no access permission).

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.WAS_STOPPED
member.summary: Indicates that the query was stopped by the user and did not answer fast enough to be successful.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.EXPIRED
member.summary: Indicates that the query execution has taken too much time and has been stopped by the system.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: Indicates that the source does not support the query object type.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.OVERLOADED
member.summary: Indicates that the remote source is not available right now, try later.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.TOO_MANY_RESULTS
member.summary: The query would return too many results, try to be more specific.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.QUERY_SYNTAX_NOT_VALID
member.summary: The query syntax is not valid

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatus.WILDCARD_SYNTAX_ERROR
member.summary: Unsupported wild card syntax

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo
member.summary:
The RepositoryStatusInfo aggregates the information on how the search executed on a single repository.
This object is returned as a report after a call to the SearchService.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.ErrorTrace
member.summary: The full stack trace of the error for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.Name
member.summary: The Repository name this Status applies to.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.Status
member.summary: The main Status for this Repository.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.DetailedStatus
member.summary:
The detailed Status of the query execution against the associated repository.
The detailed Status can be used whatever the main Status is (SUCCESS or FAILURE).
It can also be null.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.ErrorMessage
member.summary: The Error Message if it exists. Contains null or The non localized error message for debugging purpose.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.HitCount
member.summary:
The total number of objects matching the Query in the associated repository.
Note: The number of returned object is likely to be lower than the HitCount, because of the system internal limits configured for performance or optimization reasons. Contains The positive number of matching objects or -1 if this capability is not supported by the repository.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.ResultsCount
member.summary:
The number of objects returned from the defined repository for the Query.
Note: In case of multi repository query, the number of objects effectively returned in the QueryResult's dataPackage can be lower than this value, depending on the starting index and order of arrival.

member.name: P:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryStatusInfo.HasMoreResults
member.summary: Contains true if the Repository can be asked for more results.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Query.RepositoryType
member.summary:
Defines the type of a Repository.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Aspect
member.summary:
This class models Aspects for all persistent objects.
Aspects have names.
Aspects can be attached to an existing object by setting the aspect name and intent modifier to AspectIntentModifier.ATTACH.
Aspects can be dettached from an existing object by setting the aspect name and intent modifier to AspectIntentModifier.DETACH.
For the creation of new objects the intent modifier of AspectIntentModifier.ATTACH is assumed.

member.summary:
The DataObject class generally functions as a representation of a repository object.
A DataObject can potentially contain comprehensive information about the repository object that it represents, including its identity, properties, content, and its relationships to other repository objects.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectId
member.summary:
An ObjectId is a container for the value of a repository r_object_id attribute.
which is a value generated by Content Server to uniquely identify a specific version of a repository object. An ObjectId can therefore represent either a CURRENT or a non-CURRENT version of a repository object. Platform services exhibit have service and operation-specific behaviors for handling non-CURRENT versions, which are documented under the individual operations.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentity
member.summary:
The function of the ObjectIdentity class is to uniquely identify a repository object.
An ObjectIdentity instance contains a repository name and a unique identifier that can take various forms, specified by enum constants. When constructing a DataObject to pass to the create operation, or in any case when the DataObject represents a repository object that does not yet exist, the ObjectIdentity need only be populated with a repository name. If the ObjectIdentity does contain a unique identifier, it must represent an existing repository object.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentitySet
member.summary:
An ObjectIdentitySet is a simple container for ObjectIdentity instances.
It can be passed to an object service operation so that it can process multiple repository object in a single service interaction. An ObjectIdentitySet is analogous to a DataPackage, but is passed to service operations such as move, copy, and delete that operate only against existing repository data, and which therefore do not require any data from the consumer about the repository objects other than their identity.

member.summary: The function of the ObjectIdentityType enum is to specify the kind of identity used in .

member.summary: Undefined type.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentityType.OBJECT_ID
member.summary: Object ID represents some proprietary mechanism (public URI structure is not required) for combining object and repository identification. For example in Documentum, ObjectId would be a string based identifier with position encoded repository ID. This repository ID can be uniquely mapped to a repositoryName. Object ID would normally require persistent object schema helpers to identify repository name.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentityType.OBJECT_KEY
member.summary: A set of properties that together (logical AND) compose the object identity. Note that PropertyBasedIdentity also contains repositoryName necessary to globally identify the object.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentityType.OBJECT_PATH
member.summary: Object Path is used to identify the object. Path object contains a string based path expression, repository name as well as optional path type.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentityType.QUALIFICATION
member.summary: Qualification object is used, containing qualification expression as well as repository name. For example, Qualification object can contain a portion of a DQL query without "select attr_list" clause. Constraint: If Qualification is used as object identity it must be resolvable to a unique object.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentityType.COMPOSITE_OBJECT_ID
member.summary: An object id made up of more than one attribute. Works like a composite key.

member.name: F:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectIdentityType.STRING_URI
member.summary: Any URI structure compliant identity of the object. It must include/encode repository identification and thus represent a complete global object reference with PUBLIC structure. Example: "documentum:/dm_notes/12345"

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectPath
member.summary:
An ObjectPath contains a String expression specifying the path to a repository object. For example "/MyCabinet/MyFolder/MyDocument".
ObjectPath contains a String expression specifying the path to a repository object excluding the repository name. An ObjectPath can only represent the CURRENT version of a repository object. Using an ObjectPath does not guarantee the uniqueness of the repository object, because Content Server does permit objects with identical names to reside within the same folder.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ObjectRelationship
member.summary:
An ObjectRelationship represents a relationship to a new or existing repository object.
An ObjectRelationship is used by the update operation to either update or create target objects. If an ObjectRelationship received by an update operation represents a new repository object, the object is created. If the ObjectRelationship represents an existing repository object, the object is updated. A possible use case would be the creation of a new folder and a set of new documents linked to the folder.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Relationship
member.summary:
This class models relationships for all persistent objects.
Relationships have names and roles on both ends. Relation name can be set to the name of the relationType attribute of dm_relation_type. As a result, an instance of dm_relation object will be addressable and can be created or located. Sub-types of dm_relation are not supported unless DFC "relationship extensions" are configured for it.
An existing relation may be removed from data base by setting the right target, relation name, target role and RelationshipIntentModifier.REMOVE.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.OperationOptions
member.summary:
OperationOptions is a container that stores Profiles and Properties that change the behaviour of core services.
This class is passed to almost all core services methods and intend to influence the behaviour and the execution of them. It is divided into two parts: a List of s and a .
It has also a specific behaviour, when it does not contain properties or a specific profile it will try to retrieve them from ServiceContext.
Profiles - Do not contain multiple instances of the same profile class.
PropertySet - in D6 are not influencing the core services.

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.Permission
member.summary:
Permission class represent the permissions of the user defined in the service context on the repository object represented by the DataObject.
The intent of the Permission list is to provide the client with read access to the current users permissions on a repository object. The client cannot set or update permissions on a repository object by modifying the Permission list and updating the DataObject. To actually change the permissions, the client would need to modify or replace the repository objects permission set (ACL).

member.name: T:Emc.Documentum.FS.DataModel.Core.ReferenceRelationship
member.summary:
A ReferenceRelationship represents a relationship to an existing repository object.
It is specified using an . A ReferenceRelationship can be used to create a relationship between two objects, but it cannot be used to update or create target objects. A common use case would be linking a repository object (as it is created or * updated) into an existing folder.
